info.name: Approval Workflow System
info.description:
A hierarchical approval workflow system with department-based routing

#### **Key Features:**

- Multi-level approval chains
    
- Department-specific workflows
    
- Request tracking with status history
    
- JWT Authentication  
      
    Base URL:
    

[http://loclhost:8000/api](http://loclhost:8000/api)

request.description:
### Register New User

This endpoint is used to register a new user.

#### Request Body

- `username` (text): The username of the user.
    
- `email` (text): The email address of the user.
    
- `password` (text): The password for the user account.
    
- `password_confirmation` (text): The confirmation of the password.
    

#### Response

The response will contain the details of the newly registered user, including the `username`, `email`, `department_id`, `updated_at`, `created_at`, and `id`.

``` json
Example:{
    "message": "User registered successfully",
    "user": {
        "username": "john",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "department_id": null,
        "updated_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
        "created_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
        "id": 1
    },
    "token": "1|PLGEK5WwJhTcqJSLzkbSyvT1ImEDe3FKWlf1S5P088ac0f79"
}

 ```

request.description:
### Login User

This endpoint is used to authenticate and login a user by providing their email and password through a form-data request body.

#### Request Body Parameters

- email (text): The email address of the user.
    
- password (text): The password of the user.
    

#### Response

Upon a successful request, the server responds with a status code of 200 and a JSON object containing the following properties:

- message (string): A message related to the login process.
    
- user (object): An object containing user details including id, username, email, is_active status, department_id, created_at, and updated_at.
    
- token (string): The authentication token for the logged-in user.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
    "message": "User logged in successfully",
    "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "username": "john",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "is_active": 1,
        "department_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z"
    },
    "token": "2|5z5th8lJ9dGAYi9k6Wji6hYMtQw4HPzH5w2Keep23c77d9d9"
}

 ```

The endpoint retrieves a list of users from the API. The response is in JSON format and includes the following fields:

- current_page (number): The current page of the result set.
    
- data (array): An array of user objects, each containing the following fields:
    
    - id (number): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - username (string): The username of the user.
        
    - email (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - is_active (number): Indicates whether the user is active.
        
    - department_id (number): The identifier of the department to which the user belongs.
        
    - created_at (string): The date and time when the user was created.
        
    - updated_at (string): The date and time when the user was last updated.
        
    - department (object): An object representing the department details of the user.
        
- first_page_url (string): The URL of the first page of the result set.
    
- from (number): The starting index of the result set.
    
- last_page (number): The total number of pages in the result set.
    
- last_page_url (string): The URL of the last page of the result set.
    
- links (array): An array of link objects, each containing the following fields:
    
    - url (string): The URL of the link.
        
    - label (string): The label of the link.
        
    - active (boolean): Indicates whether the link is active.
        
- next_page_url (string): The URL of the next page in the result set, if available.
    
- path (string): The path of the current request.
    
- per_page (number): The number of items per page.
    
- prev_page_url (string): The URL of the previous page in the result set, if available.
    
- to (number): The ending index of the result set.
    
- total (number): The total number of users in the result set.
    

Example response:

``` json
{
  "data": [
    {
      "id": 0,
      "name": "",
      "email": "",
      "created_at": "",
      "updated_at": ""
    }
  ],
  "status": 0
}

 ```

response.name: all_users
response.body:
{
    "current_page": 1,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 1,
            "username": "john",
            "email": "john@example.com",
            "is_active": 1,
            "department_id": null,
            "created_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
            "department": null
        }
    ],
    "first_page_url": "http://localhost:8000/api/users?page=1",
    "from": 1,
    "last_page": 1,
    "last_page_url": "http://localhost:8000/api/users?page=1",
    "links": [
        {
            "url": null,
            "label": "« Previous",
            "active": false
        },
        {
            "url": "http://localhost:8000/api/users?page=1",
            "label": "1",
            "active": true
        },
        {
            "url": null,
            "label": "Next »",
            "active": false
        }
    ],
    "next_page_url": null,
    "path": "http://localhost:8000/api/users",
    "per_page": 10,
    "prev_page_url": null,
    "to": 1,
    "total": 1
}

request.description:
# Get User Details

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific user.

## Request

### Request URL

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/users/1`
    

## Response

- Status: 200 OK
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "id": 1,
    "username": "john",
    "email": "john@example.com",
    "is_active": 1,
    "department_id": null,
    "created_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
    "updated_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
    "department": null
}

 ```

### Update User Details

This endpoint allows updating the details of a specific user.

#### Request

- Method: PATCH
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/users/1`
    
- Headers:
    
    - Content-Type: application/json
        
- URL Parameters:
    
    - username (string, required): The new username for the user.
        

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following properties:

- message (string): A message related to the update.
    
- user (object): An object containing the updated user details with the following properties:
    
    - id (integer): The unique identifier of the user.
        
    - username (string): The updated username.
        
    - email (string): The email address of the user.
        
    - is_active (integer): The status of the user account.
        
    - department_id (integer): The department ID of the user.
        
    - created_at (string): The timestamp of user creation.
        
    - updated_at (string): The timestamp of the last update.
        

``` json
{
    "message": "User updated successfully",
    "user": {
        "id": 1,
        "username": "john cena",
        "email": "john@example.com",
        "is_active": 1,
        "department_id": null,
        "created_at": "2025-03-28T00:36:15.000000Z",
        "updated_at": "2025-03-28T01:00:18.000000Z"
    }
}

 ```

### Delete User

This endpoint is used to delete a specific user.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/users/2`
    

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content Type: application/json
    
- { "message": "User deactivated successfully"}

### GET /api/departments

This endpoint retrieves a list of departments.

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "current_page": number,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": number,
      "name": string,
      "description": string,
      "is_active": string,
      "created_at": string,
      "updated_at": string
    }
  ],
  "first_page_url": string,
  "from": number,
  "last_page": number,
  "last_page_url": string,
  "links": [
    {
      "url": string,
      "label": string,
      "active": boolean
    }
  ],
  "next_page_url": string,
  "path": string,
  "per_page": number,
  "prev_page_url": string,
  "to": number,
  "total": number
}

 ```

response.name: all_departments
response.body:

        {
            "id": 2,

        },
        {
            "id": 1,

            "description": "finance",
            "is_active": "1",
            "created_at": "2025-03-28T01:09:09.000000Z",
            "updated_at": "2025-03-28T01:09:09.000000Z"
        }
    ],
    "first_page_url": "http://localhost:8000/api/departments?page=1",
    "from": 1,
    "last_page": 1,
    "last_page_url": "http://localhost:8000/api/departments?page=1",
    "links": [
        {
            "url": null,
            "label": "« Previous",
            "active": false
        },
        {
            "url": "http://localhost:8000/api/departments?page=1",
            "label": "1",
            "active": true
        },
        {
            "url": null,
            "label": "Next »",
            "active": false
        }
    ],
    "next_page_url": null,
    "path": "http://localhost:8000/api/departments",
    "per_page": 10,
    "prev_page_url": null,
    "to": 2,
    "total": 2
}

request.description:
### Create Department

This endpoint allows you to create a new department by making an HTTP POST request to the specified URL. The request should include the department name and description as query parameters.

#### Request Body

The request body should not include any additional parameters as the department details are provided in the query string.

- `name`: (string) The name of the department.
    
- `description`: (string) The description of the department.
    

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the response will include the department's data, including the name, description, updated_at, created_at, and id. The status field indicates the success of the request.

Example response:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "department": {
        "name": "",
        "description": "",
        "updated_at": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "id": 0
    }
}

 ```

### Retrieve Department Details

This endpoint makes an HTTP GET request to retrieve the details of a specific department with the ID of 1.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/departments/1`
    

#### Response

The response will be a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "department": {
    "id": 0,
    "name": "",
    "description": "",
    "is_active": "",
    "created_at": "",
    "updated_at": ""
  }
}

 ```

The `department` object contains the details of the department including `id`, `name`, `description`, `is_active`, `created_at`, and `updated_at`.

# Update Department Details

This endpoint allows updating the details of a specific department.

## Request

- Method: PATCH
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/departments/2`
    
- Headers:
    
    - Content-Type: application/json
        
- URL Parameters:
    
    - name (string, required): The new name of the department.
        
    - description (string, required): The new description of the department.
        

## Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "message": "", "department": { "id": 0, "name": "", "description": "", "is_active": "", "created_at": "", "updated_at": "" } }
    

The response contains a message field and the updated department details including its ID, name, description, is_active status, creation timestamp, and last update timestamp.

### Delete Department

This endpoint is used to delete a specific department.

#### Request

- Method: DELETE
    
- Endpoint: `/api/departments/3`
    

#### Response

The response for this request follows the JSON schema below:

``` json
{
  "message": "string"
}

 ```

### GET /api/requests

This endpoint retrieves a list of requests.

#### Response

The response is a JSON object with the following schema:

``` json
{
  "current_page": number,
  "data": [
    {
      "id": number,
      "requester_id": number,
      "title": string,
      "description": string,
      "status": string,
      "created_at": string,
      "updated_at": string,
      "status_label": string,
      "requester": {
        "id": number,
        "username": string,
        "email": string,
        "is_active": number,
        "department_id": number,
        "created_at": string,
        "updated_at": string,
        "department": {
          "id": number,
          "name": string,
          "description": string,
          "is_active": string,
          "created_at": string,
          "updated_at": string
        }
      },
      "approval_steps": [
        {
          "id": number,
          "request_id": number,
          "approver_id": number,
          "status": string,
          "comment": string or null,
          "action_date": string,
          "created_at": string,
          "updated_at": string,
          "status_label": string,
          "approver": {
            "id": number,
            "username": string,
            "email": string,
            "is_active": number,
            "department_id": number,
            "created_at": string or null,
            "updated_at": string or null
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "first_page_url": string,
  "from": number,
  "last_page": number,
  "last_page_url": string,
  "links": [
    {
      "url": string or null,
      "label": string,
      "active": boolean
    }
  ],
  "next_page_url": string or null,
  "path": string,
  "per_page": number,
  "prev_page_url": string or null,
  "to": number,
  "total": number
}

 ```

request.description:
### Create New Request

This endpoint allows you to create a new request by making an HTTP POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body

The request body should include the following parameters in a raw JSON format:

- `title`: (string) The title of the request.
    
- `description`: (string) The description of the request.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "title": "laptop",
    "description": "laptop and mouse"
}

 ```

#### Response

Upon successful creation, the response will include the request's data, including the title, description, status, requester_id, updated_at, created_at, id, and status_label.

Example response:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "request": {
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
        "status": "",
        "requester_id": 0,
        "updated_at": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "id": 0,
        "status_label": ""
    }
}

 ```

### GET /api/requests/2

This endpoint retrieves the details of a specific request with ID 2.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

``` json
{
    "request": {
        "id": 0,
        "requester_id": 0,
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
        "status": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "updated_at": "",
        "status_label": "",
        "requester": {
            "id": 0,
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "is_active": 0,
            "department_id": 0,
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": "",
            "department": {
                "id": 0,
                "name": "",
                "description": "",
                "is_active": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        },
        "approval_steps": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "request_id": 0,
                "approver_id": 0,
                "status": "",
                "comment": null,
                "action_date": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": "",
                "status_label": "",
                "approver": {
                    "id": 0,
                    "username": "",
                    "email": "",
                    "is_active": 0,
                    "department_id": 0,
                    "created_at": null,
                    "updated_at": null
                }
            }
        ]
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Show Exiting approval steps for request

This endpoint is used to shows approval steps for a specific request.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- Endpoint: `/api/requests/2/steps`
    
- Headers: No specific headers required
    
- Authentication: No specific authentication required
    

#### Response

The response for this request is a JSON array with the following schema:

``` json
[
  {
    "id": "number",
    "request_id": "number",
    "approver_id": "number",
    "status": "string",
    "comment": "string or null",
    "action_date": "string",
    "created_at": "string",
    "updated_at": "string",
    "status_label": "string",
    "approver": {
      "id": "number",
      "username": "string",
      "email": "string",
      "is_active": "number",
      "department_id": "number",
      "created_at": "string or null",
      "updated_at": "string or null",
      "department": {
        "id": "number",
        "name": "string",
        "description": "string",
        "is_active": "string",
        "created_at": "string",
        "updated_at": "string"
      }
    }
  }
]

 ```

### Get Approval Flows

This endpoint retrieves the approval flows from the server.

#### Request

- Method: GET
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/approval-flows`
    

#### Response

The response will be in JSON format and will include the following fields:

- `current_page` (number): The current page of the results.
    
- `data` (array): An array of approval flow objects, each containing `id`, `approver_id`, `level`, `is_active`, `created_at`, `updated_at`, and `approver` details.
    
    - `id` (number): The ID of the approval flow.
        
    - `approver_id` (number): The ID of the approver.
        
    - `level` (string): The level of the approval flow.
        
    - `is_active` (string): The status of the approval flow.
        
    - `created_at` (string): The creation timestamp of the approval flow.
        
    - `updated_at` (string): The last update timestamp of the approval flow.
        
    - `approver` (object): Details of the approver.
        
        - `id` (number): The ID of the approver.
            
        - `username` (string): The username of the approver.
            
        - `email` (string): The email of the approver.
            
        - `is_active` (number): The status of the approver.
            
        - `department_id` (number): The ID of the department to which the approver belongs.
            
        - `created_at` (string): The creation timestamp of the approver.
            
        - `updated_at` (string): The last update timestamp of the approver.
            
- `first_page_url` (string): The URL of the first page of results.
    
- `from` (number): The index of the first item in the current page of results.
    
- `last_page` (number): The index of the last page of results.
    
- `last_page_url` (string): The URL of the last page of results.
    
- `links` (array): An array of links related to the results.
    
    - `url` (string): The URL of the link.
        
    - `label` (string): The label of the link.
        
    - `active` (boolean): The status of the link.
        
- `next_page_url` (string): The URL of the next page of results.
    
- `path` (string): The path of the current request.
    
- `per_page` (number): The number of items per page.
    
- `prev_page_url` (string): The URL of the previous page of results.
    
- `to` (number): The index of the last item in the current page of results.
    
- `total` (number): The total number of results.
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "current_page": 0,
    "data": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "approver_id": 0,
            "level": "",
            "is_active": "",
 ```

request.description:
### Create Approval Flow

This endpoint allows the client to create a new approval flow by sending a POST request to the specified URL.

#### Request Body

- `approver_id` (integer): The ID of the approver for the approval flow.
    
- `level` (string): The level of the approval flow.
    

Example:

``` json
{
    "approver_id": 1,
    "level": "1"
}

 ```

#### Response

Upon a successful creation, the server responds with a status code of 201 and a JSON object containing the message and details of the created approval flow.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "approval_flow": {
        "approver_id": 0,
        "level": "",
        "updated_at": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "id": 0,
        "approver": {
            "id": 0,
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "is_active": 0,
            "department_id": 0,
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": "",
            "department": {
                "id": 0,
                "name": "",
                "description": "",
                "is_active": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        }
    }
}

 ```

        "created_at": "2025-03-28T01:41:16.000000Z",

            }
        }
    }
}

request.description:
### Update Approval Flow

This endpoint is used to update the approval flow for a specific approver.

#### Request

- Method: PATCH
    
- URL: `http://localhost:8000/api/approval-flows/1?approver_id=3`
    
- Headers:
    
    - Content-Type: application/json
        
- Body:
    
    - No specific request body parameters provided.
        

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    
- { "message": "", "approval_flow": { "id": 0, "approver_id": 0, "level": "", "is_active": "", "created_at": "", "updated_at": "", "approver": { "id": 0, "username": "", "email": "", "is_active": 0, "department_id": 0, "created_at": null, "updated_at": null } }}
    

#### Example

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "approval_flow": {
        "id": 0,
        "approver_id": 0,
        "level": "",
        "is_active": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "updated_at": "",
        "approver": {
            "id": 0,
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "is_active": 0,
            "department_id": 0,
            "created_at": null,
            "updated_at": null
        }
    }
}

 ```

### Delete Approval Flow

This endpoint is used to delete an approval flow with the specified ID.

#### Request Body

This request does not require a request body.

#### Response

- Status: 200
    
- Content-Type: application/json
    

Example Response Body:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "remaining_approvers": [
        {
            "id": 0,
            "approver_id": 0,
            "level": "",
            "is_active": "",
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": ""
        }
    ]
}

 ```

This endpoint makes an HTTP POST request to approve a specific request. The request body should be in raw format and include a "comment" key with the value of the comment to be added.

### Request Body

- `comment`: (string) The comment to be added for the approval.
    

### Response

The response will have a status code of 200 and a content type of application/json. The response body will include a "message" field and details of the approved request, including the request ID, requester details, approval steps, and requester's department information.

Example Response:

``` json
{
    "message": "",
    "request": {
        "id": 0,
        "requester_id": 0,
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
        "status": "",
        "created_at": "",
        "updated_at": "",
        "status_label": "",
        "approval_steps": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "request_id": 0,
                "approver_id": 0,
                "status": "",
                "comment": "",
                "action_date": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": "",
                "status_label": "",
                "approver": {
                    "id": 0,
                    "username": "",
                    "email": "",
                    "is_active": 0,
                    "department_id": 0,
                    "created_at": "",
                    "updated_at": ""
                }
            }
        ],
        "requester": {
            "id": 0,
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "is_active": 0,
            "department_id": 0,
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": "",
            "department": {
                "id": 0,
                "name": "",
                "description": "",
                "is_active": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        }
    }
}

 ```

request.description:
### Reject Request

This endpoint is used to reject a specific request.

#### Request Body

- `comment` (string, required): A comment explaining the reason for rejection.
    

#### Response

- `message` (string): A message indicating the result of the rejection.
    
- `request` (object): Details of the rejected request including ID, requester ID, title, description, status, creation and update timestamps, status label, approval steps, and requester information.
    

#### Example Response

```
{
    "message": "",
    "request": {
        "id": 0,
        "requester_id": 0,
        "title": "",
        "description": "",
        "status": "",
        "created_at": null,
        "updated_at": "",
        "status_label": "",
        "approval_steps": [
            {
                "id": 0,
                "request_id": 0,
                "approver_id": 0,
                "status": "",
                "comment": "",
                "action_date": "",
                "created_at": null,
                "updated_at": "",
                "status_label": "",
                "approver": {
                    "id": 0,
                    "username": "",
                    "email": "",
                    "is_active": 0,
                    "department_id": 0,
                    "created_at": "",
                    "updated_at": ""
                }
            }
        ],
        "requester": {
            "id": 0,
            "username": "",
            "email": "",
            "is_active": 0,
            "department_id": 0,
            "created_at": "",
            "updated_at": "",
            "department": {
                "id": 0,
                "name": "",
                "description": "",
                "is_active": "",
                "created_at": "",
                "updated_at": ""
            }
        }
    }
}

 ```
